name: wtf8::Wtf8Buf::push_code_point_unchecked

core::wtf8::CodePoint::to_u32.doc: Returns the numeric value of the code point.

core::char::encode_utf8_raw.doc:
Encodes a raw `u32` value as UTF-8 into the provided byte buffer,
 and then returns the subslice of the buffer that contains the encoded character.

 Unlike `char::encode_utf8`, this method also handles codepoints in the surrogate range.
 (Creating a `char` in the surrogate range is UB.)
 The result is valid [generalized UTF-8] but not valid UTF-8.

 [generalized UTF-8]: https://simonsapin.github.io/wtf-8/#generalized-utf8

 # Panics

 Panics if the buffer is not large enough.
 A buffer of length four is large enough to encode any `char`.

vec::Vec::<T, A>::extend_from_slice.doc:
Clones and appends all elements in a slice to the `Vec`.

 Iterates over the slice `other`, clones each element, and then appends
 it to this `Vec`. The `other` slice is traversed in-order.

 Note that this function is the same as [`extend`],
 except that it also works with slice elements that are Clone but not Copy.
 If Rust gets specialization this function may be deprecated.

 # Panics

 Panics if the new capacity exceeds `isize::MAX` _bytes_.

 # Examples

 ```
 let mut vec = vec![1];
 vec.extend_from_slice(&[2, 3, 4]);
 assert_eq!(vec, [1, 2, 3, 4]);
 ```

 [`extend`]: Vec::extend

doc:
Appends the given `char` to the end of this string.
 This does **not** include the WTF-8 concatenation check or `is_known_utf8` check.
 Copied from String::push.
